title: 103_hr2604
content: The "Brownsville Wetlands Policy Act of 1993" establishes the Wetlands Policy Center at the Port of Brownsville, Texas. The "Brownsville Wetlands Policy Act of 1993" establishes the Brownsville Wetlands Policy Center at the Port of Brownsville, Texas. The Center, operated by the Port of Brownsville and administered by the University of Texas at Brownsville, focuses on protecting, restoring, and maintaining the Lagoon Ecosystems of the Western Gulf of Mexico Region. The Center in the Western Gulf of Mexico Region is governed by a Board of Directors cochaired by the Port of Brownsville, the University of Texas at Brownsville, and the Fish and Wildlife Service. The Board prepares an annual report covering programs, projects, activities, and budget for submission to Congress. The Board of Directors of the Center in the Western Gulf of Mexico Region is required to review and report on the budget, funding sources, and operations of the Center. They must provide all necessary information for the preparation of annual reports, and the Comptroller General of the United States will submit periodic reports to Congress on the Center's operations. The Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service can provide grants to the Center for its activities. The Director may also lease wetlands property from the Port of Brownsville for the Center's use, with the ability to terminate the lease at any time. The University of Texas at Brownsville and the Port of Brownsville must provide space and resources for the Center as conditions for receiving assistance. The Port of Brownsville will make up to 7,000 acres of property available for the Center's programs. The Board of Directors must report annually on whether these conditions have been met. Authorization of appropriations is also included in the Act. Authorization of appropriations is granted to the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service for fiscal years 1994-1996, with additional funds as needed for 1997. None of the allocated funds can be used to relocate administrative operations from Corpus Christi State University to the Brownsville Wetlands Policy Center at the Port of Brownsville. The House of Representatives passed the authorization of appropriations on September 21, 1993.
